sense.gloss: to play (games, sports), to enjoy oneself, to have a good time
to mess about (with alcohol, gambling, philandery, etc.)
to be idle, to do nothing, to be unused
to meet up (with friends), to hang out
to give oneself up (to gambling, drinking, etc.)
to go to (for pleasure or for study)
to intentionally throw a ball to lower the batter's concentration

sdata.j: ↑海辺↑↓うみべ↓は↑子供↑↓こども↓たちが|↑遊↑↓あそ↓ぶ|のに↑理想↑↓りそう↓↑的↑↓てき↓な↑場所↑↓ばしょ↓だ。
sdata.e: The seaside is an ideal spot for the children to play.

sdata.j: ↑火↑↓ひ↓の↑近↑↓ちか↓くで|↑遊↑↓あそ↓ぶ|のは↑危険↑↓きけん↓だ。
sdata.e: It's dangerous to play around the fire.

sdata.j: ↑一般↑↓いっぱん↓↑的↑↓てき↓に↑言↑↓い↓って、↑子供↑↓こども↓は↑戸外↑↓こがい↓で|↑遊↑↓あそ↓ぶ|のが↑好↑↓す↓きだ。
sdata.e: Generally speaking, children like to play outdoors.

sdata.j: ビルはよく↑一↑↓ひと↓↑人↑↓り↓でおもちゃで|↑遊↑↓あそ↓ぶ|。
sdata.e: Bill often plays with toys by himself.

sdata.j: トムには↑一緒↑↓いっしょ↓に|↑遊↑↓あそ↓ぶ|↑友達↑↓ともだち↓がいません。
sdata.e: Tom has no friends to play with.

sdata.j: たまには↑楽↑↓たの↓しく|↑遊↑↓あそ↓ぶ|ことが↑必要↑↓ひつよう↓だ。
sdata.e: You need to enjoy yourself and have fun once in a while.

sdata.j: その↑女↑↓おんな↓の↑子↑↓こ↓は↑一人↑↓ひとり↓ぼっちで|↑遊↑↓あそ↓ぶ|ことに↑慣↑↓な↓れている。
sdata.e: The girl is used to playing all by herself.

sdata.j: その↑拳銃↑↓けんじゅう↓で|↑遊↑↓あそ↓ぶ|な。おもちゃではないんだぞ。
sdata.e: Don't play with that gun. It's not a toy.

sdata.j: うちの↑娘↑↓むすめ↓と|↑遊↑↓あそ↓ぶ|↑時間↑↓じかん↓はありますか。
sdata.e: Can you find the time to play with our daughter?

sdata.j: あの↑子↑↓こ↓もおもちゃで|↑遊↑↓あそ↓ぶ|↑年↑↓とし↓は↑過↑↓す↓ぎるころだ。
sdata.e: He will soon be past playing with toys.
